title: The Great Ramses, a champion horse
features: First Person account told through the eyes of an equestrian event horse, chronicling his 34 year career from his birth in Europe and eventual retirement in the hills of Malibu California. Lovingly illustrated with archival photos and beautiful renderings, packed with unique details all told from the horses point of view, it gives the young reader a window into the world of equestrian riding as well as the animals experience in the human world. For the animal lover or riding enthusiast, The Great Ramses provides an exciting read and an experience of the deeply loving relationship between horse and mankind.
description: I loved this story so much, so funny, so sad, Sorry I never met Ramses... --Hanna H. 13, rides a horse named CharlieThe remarkable journey of the horse we all came to appreciate and enjoy. He was indeed an amazing jumper. During my training of him Ramses won team Gold for young riders. Every horse loving young rider will enjoy this captivating emotional story. well done.... --Button Baker, professional trainerThe remarkable journey of the horse we all came to appreciate and enjoy. Gardy Weickert has been an equestrienne for over 30 years in the competitive rings of Europe and North America to the wilds of Africa. Her involvement with horses and love of nature has been a life-long passion both as a photographer and rider, and this novella comes from her relationship with her beloved Ramses, a Dutch Warmblood that came into her life over 15 years ago. Her love of horses and desire to share this experience with young readers has produced her first work, The Great Ramses.
